Representative Mike Pence of Indiana announced Thursday that he would not be a Republican candidate for president in 2012, but he left the door open to running for governor. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mr. Mike Pence wrote in a letter to supporters. "We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012." The decision of Mr. Mike Pence , which was first reported by The Indianapolis Star,

Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle King , said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said.
